metadata.Title: CVE-2022-27666 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in IPsec ESP transformation code innet/ipv4/esp4.c and net/ipv6/esp6.c. This flaw allows a local attacker witha normal user privilege to overwrite kernel heap objects and may cause alocal privilege escalation threat.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
